intro: Calycosia trichocalyx, commonly known as the Chinese aster, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and showy purple to pink flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Calycosia trichocalyx prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a versatile addition to various garden settings.
